availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry E. Haynes (Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Ohio County, Kentucky, native. Son of Hardin Haynes and Polly Haynes. Married to Margaret C. Powers Haynes on July 2, 1857. Father of Benjamin Haynes, R. F. Haynes, Henry Haynes, Jr., and Walter Haynes. Educated in Ohio County. Farmer in Hancock County in 1850, 1860, and 1863.

bibl.p: J. H. Battle, W. H. Perrin, & G. C. Kniffin. Kentucky: A History of the State 3rd Ed. (Louisville:Battey Publishing, 1886), 748; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 276; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 57; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Indian Creek, p. 17; Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Hancock County, KY, 1863, p. 10, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
